column6: Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: The CommitteeÃ¢ÂÂs Chair is the CFO, supported by the Sustainability team. Regional climate sponsors and working groups are responsible for reporting on the progress of regional and country-based climate-related initiatives. This year, SEEK continued to engage on climate-related issues by hiring external climate experts to conduct climate scenario analysis on priority climate risks and general climate knowledge sharing across regions.

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column7: SEEK remains committed to continuously improving the overall work environment to attract and retain the best people across SEEKÃ¢ÂÂs markets. Current initiatives include reviewing policies, perks, and benefits across APAC to improve the employee experience and better communicate SEEKÃ¢ÂÂs employee value proposition and branding. Across the APAC business, SEEK retained 89% of its permanent employees in FY2023. Annualised voluntary attrition was 11%, and total annualised attrition was 13% across APAC. It represents a significant decrease compared to prior years and reflects the changing sentiment within the technology sector.

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: Roles at SEEK are predominantly professional, and employees are engaged on independent contracts. Remuneration is set competitively to attract and retain high-performing talent. Depending on role type and seniority, permanent employees are also given an annual variable-pay opportunity, either cash or equity.
column20: Independent Contracts, High-Performing Talent, Annual Variable-Pay Opportunity

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: In FY2023, SEEK launched a new joint employee share plan for all eligible employees across APAC. Ã¢ÂÂShares@SEEKÃ¢ÂÂ allows people to own a stake in the company by buying shares, with SEEK matching their purchase subject to tenure. A personÃ¢ÂÂs long-term commitment and contribution to SEEK is rewarded by checking one additional share for every two shares held after two years at no extra cost. More than one-third of employees have chosen to participate in the program.

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: In ANZ, benefits include salary continuance insurance. Employees are also paid statutory superannuation to their chosen superannuation or pension fund. In Asia, benefits include medical insurance for employees and their dependents and death and disability insurance coverage.
column20: Salary Continuance Insurance, Pension Fund, Medical Insurance

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: A range of leave provisions, programs and initiatives to support physical and mental well-being are available. In addition to other leave entitlements, SEEK provides paid Personal Flexi-Leave each year so employees can attend to personal and family matters outside work. No value judgement or rationale is required to utilise this leave, as SEEK acknowledges that people have different life commitments.
column20: Leave Provisions, Physical and Mental Wellbeing, Personal Flexi-Leave

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: No value judgement or rationale is required to utilise this leave, as SEEK acknowledges that people have different life commitments. column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: During FY2023, the Committee continued the rollout of an inclusive leadership program for technology leaders, delivered in partnership with the NeuroLeadership Institute. There was a continuing focus on supporting women in progressing their careers in technology through education events and frameworks that monitor and actively promote career moves within SEEK.\t

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: SEEKÃ¢ÂÂs graduate programs help build the talent pipeline by recruiting final-year university students for technology, strategy, and operations positions each year. The graduate recruitment strategy ensures solid female representation within different candidate pools and equitable gender representation on assessment days. Specific strategies include dedicated events to promote the program to female and non-binary applicants and sponsorship of female university clubs.

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: Camp SEEK is an annual event that addresses the shortage of women in the technology industry. The event introduces Year 9 and 10 girls and non-binary young people to various career paths within the industry to inspire them to pursue future studies and choose a career in science, technology, engineering, or mathematics.

column13: Achieving gender balance in hiring outcomes is challenging for specific technology roles due to the under-representation of female candidates in the market. column13: SEEK supports its people through challenging times in their personal lives, including situations of domestic and family abuse. Under the Family and Domestic Violence Policy, those in need can access paid leave and external professional support.

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: SEEK has a formal policy and grievance process for preventing discrimination and harassment, supplemented by mandatory Equal Employment Opportunity compliance training for ANZ-based employees. It is being adapted for implementation across Asia. SEEK has zero tolerance for sexual harassment, and where complaints are received, they are thoroughly investigated, and appropriate actions are taken.

column13: The LeadingSEEK program was a significant investment in FY2022 to build leadership capability in the 50 most senior leaders at SEEK. This cohort has now been formally established as the APAC Senior Leadership Team. This team meets bi-monthly to discuss critical business and leadership topics and continue strengthening senior relationships. In this sense, leadership development continues collectively and at functional team and individual levels. Individual leaders are building on lessons from the program, with their development plans having been defined as part of the program.
column20: LeadingSEEK, Investment, Leadership Capability
